title: PrepXtra Friday Night Lights: Week 9
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest PrepXtra Friday Night Lights: Week 9 Here are the Week 9 highlights from PrepXtra, which airs every Friday night at 11 p.m., on WBIR. Check out this story on WBIR.com: http://on.wbir.com/1RNDzHQ Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs PrepXtra Friday Night Lights: Week 9 Katherine Donnelly, 12:07 a.m. EDT October 17, 2015 3 CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Believe it or not Week 9 of the high school football season just wrapped up. Here are the highlights from PrepXtra, which airs every Friday night at 11 p.m., on WBIR. For an entire list of scores click here . 
PrepXtra Game of the Week: Catholic 42, Carter 6 Highlights from Catholic's 42-6 win over Carter. 
The PrepXtra Game of the Week featured two teams battling for a playoff spot. Catholic's Amari Rodgers absolutely went off tonight. He had four touchdowns total including a 55 yard punt return for a touchdown. Catholic (4-4) claimed a spot in the postseason with its 42-6 win over Carter (3-5) tonight. Carter travels to Gibbs for Week 10, while Catholic hosts Cloudland. 
Rockwood 33, Austin-East 26 Patrick Murray gives you the highlights from Rockwood's 33-26 win over Austin-East. 
Rockwood (6-2) and Austin-East (6-2) competed in a Region 2, 2A battle tonight. Both teams were scoreless in the first quarter. Then in the second, Isaiah Jones of Rockwood broke some tackles and got it across the goal line.Tigers up 7-0. Austin-eastamswered immediately. Daruis Harper went over the middle to Kashif Warren Jr. He went 76 yards to the house to make the game 7-6. About two minutes left before the half, Rockwood's Will Warner got it to Isaiah Jones. He went down the sideline, broke a tackle and dove into the endzone. Rockwood was up 19-14 at the half. Austin-East tried to make a comeback in the fourth quarter but Rockwood came away with the win 33-26. Austin-East has a region game against Sweetwater, and Rockwood has a region game against Wartburg. 
West 21, Heritage 20 Highlights from West's 21-20 win over Heritage. 
Heritage (3-5) and West (7-1) entered tonight's game tied atop the Region 2-5A standings. The Mountaineers defense was strong tonight. Kyle Valentine had a nice pick that set up a touchdown for Heritage. Mountaineers were up 7-0. Zach Harshey got some revenge for West with his bomb to Jermaine Buchannon for a 61 yard touchdown to make it a tie game. It was back and forth between both teams tonight, but West sneaked by with a 21-20 win.Heritage hosts Clinton next week, and West has a exciting matchup against Fulton. 
Alcoa 42, Kingston 13 Highlights from Alcoa's 42-13 win over Kingston 
Alcoa (7-1) started out its game against Kingston (7-2) on a pretty good note. The Yellow Jackets punted on their first drive and Alcoa returned it 80 yards for a touchdown to go up 7-0. But Paul Bolden from Kingston came to play. Bolden made a 34 yard touchdown run to make the score 7-6. Jalen Myers did the exact same thing for Alcoa though. Ran it right up the middle. Alcoa went on to beat Kingston 42-13. Since Alcoa won tonight they have home field advantage in the first two rounds of the postseason. Alcoa's next game is at Red Bank, and Kingston has Week 10 off. 
Farragut 38, Lenoir City 10 Highlights from Farragut's 38-10 win over Lenoir City. 
It was a region game over at Farragut tonight. Farragut was leading 17-3 at halftime. Tanner Thomas has been a star all season long, and tonight was no different. He found a hole and scampered into the end zone to make it 24-3 Admirals in the third. Farragut's defense also played well tonight. Drew Butler got a pick. Farragut won 38-10 and are region champions. Farragut plays at South Doyle next week. Lenoir City hosts King's Academy. 
Maryville 42, William Blount 0 Highlights from Maryville's win over William Blount. 
The Rebels rolled right over the Governors tonight. Maryville (8-0) has now won 38 games in a row which is the longest win streak in Tennessee. Joel Hopkins got into the end zone in the first quarter to give the Rebels their first score. Kelby Brock and Jordan Ervin had touchdowns for Maryville as well in the first half. In the second half it was more of the same. Maryville shut out William Blount (2-6) 42-0. Both teams have region games next week. Maryville hosts Bradley Central, while William Blount plays at Hardin Valley. 
Scott 42, Loudon 6 Highlights from Scott's 42-6 win over Loudon. 
The Loudon Redskins (2-6) traveled to Scott High School (4-5) to take on the Highlanders on their senior night. Both teams needed a win to stay in the playoff hunt. The Highlanders got on the board first with just under nine minutes left in the first quarter after Billy Hall hit Austin Chambers in stride to put Scott up 7-0. That wouldn't be all for that duo. Hall found Chambers again for an 11-yard score to put the Highlanders up by 14 points. The Scott High defense got in on the action too. With Loudon driving late in the first quarter, Hayden Byrge stepped in front of the receiver to get the interception. The Highlanders go on to win 42-6. Loudon plays at East Ridge for Week 10. Scott has a bye. 
Harriman 34, Oneida 10 Highlights from Harriman's 34-10 win over Oneida. 
Harriman (6-2) traveled to Oneida (6-3) for a big match-up between two good teams. Oneida started off with the ball, but they threw an interception to Joe Pace of Harriman. That interception led to a touchdown by Garrett Greene. That would put the Blue Devils up six to nothing. Harriman would go up 12 to nothing when Greene would score his second touchdown of the night. The Blue Devils would go on to win this one, 34-10. Oneida has a bye Week 10. Harriman hosts region rival Greenback. 
Science Hill 48, Jefferson County 17 Science Hill defeats Jefferson County 48-17. 
Jefferson County (3-5) made a trip to the tri-cities to take on Science Hill (7-1). The Hilltoppers leaned on a 34-10 lead in the third quarter, but Jefferson County found a way to close the gap. The Patriots blocked and recovered a Hilltoppers' punt in the third. Jefferson County's Austin Jenkins found Dalton Morgan minutes later for the score to make it 34-17. On the ensuing kickoff Colby Martin scampered 85 yards down the field to the Patriots' 5-yard line. Jared Carter would punch it in for the Hilltoppers to extend their lead to 41-17. Science Hill would add another touchdown and win 48-17. Science Hill plays region rival Bearden next week. Jefferson County hosts region rival Dobyns-Bennett. 
Bearden 21, Dobyns-Bennett 9 Highlights of Bearden's 21-9 win over Dobyns-Bennett. 
Dobyns-Bennett (4-4) took an early 9-0 lead tonight, but Bearden (5-3) never got discouraged. Cameron Jones had a 50 yard touchdown run that put some life into Bearden's offense and put the Bulldogs down by two. Then Jones had another touchdown run to give Bearden a 14-9 lead. The Bulldogs put the game away when Jones hit Jordan Ferguson for a touchdown to give Bearden the sealing 21-9 win. Bearden plays Science Hill for Week 10, and Dobyns-Bennett plays Jefferson County. 
Sevier County 35, Tennessee 14 Highlights from Sevier County's 35-14 win over Tennessee. 
Deuce Wallace and Sevier County (7-2) traveled to Tennessee High (5-3). Sevier County running back Dorian Banks was on crutches in the first half. However, in the 2nd half, he came back to the field and scored a touchdown that put Sevier County up 21-14. Then, next Smokey Bears possession, Deuce Wallace hit Banks with a screen pass and he took it to the house. Sevier County won this one 35-14. Sevier County plays Thursday against Morristown West, and Tennessee plays at David Crockett. 3 CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://on.wbir.com/1RNDzHQ TOP VIDEOS
